summary: Build a website for a hardware shop named "Shankar Gared Krishi Yantra Udhog".
architectural_notes: Add admin-only access control for product management UI and product CRUD backend endpoints (authentication + authorization).
known_issues: Website is displaying a blank page (blank screen) after recent deployment/update (product-first landing view change).

existing_features.title: Create a responsive, single-page marketing website for the hardware shop named “Shankar Gared Krishi Yantra Udhog”.

Implement standard hardware-shop content sections: Header with navigation, Hero section, Product Categories, Services, About the Shop, and Contact section (including address placeholder, phone placeholder, email placeholder, and business hours placeholder).
Add a clear call-to-action area in the hero and contact sections (e.g., “Call Now” and “Get Directions”) using placeholder links that can be updated later.
Define and apply a coherent visual theme appropriate for a hardware/agri-equipment shop (distinct color palette, typography, spacing, button styles) and use it consistently across all sections.

Add generated static images to the frontend and use them in the layout (logo in header/footer; hero image in hero section; category icons/cards in categories section). Store them under frontend/public/assets/generated.

Replace the existing placeholder phone number and email address across the marketing site with phone number "9928281833" and email "sgkyu@gmail.com", ensuring both the displayed text and the underlying link targets (tel:/mailto:) are updated wherever they appear (e.g., Hero CTA, Contact section cards, Contact CTA button, and Footer contact info).

Update the site’s store address to: "Dakbel, Bagru, Rajasthan 303007" wherever the address appears (at minimum: Contact section address card and Footer contact info), replacing the current placeholder address text.

Update the map/directions links to point to the updated address (Dakbel, Bagru, Rajasthan 303007) so that the 'Get Directions' / 'Visit Our Store' CTAs open a map search for the updated address rather than only the shop name.

Create a product management UI (admin-style) that allows uploading product photos and managing product details (name, description, price): add new products, view existing products in a list/grid, edit them, and delete them.
Add a visible navigation entry point from the existing site to access the product management UI (e.g., a new header/nav item) without breaking the existing single-page marketing navigation.

Add a customer-facing product shopping view (separate from the existing Product Management admin UI) that lists all products from the backend with photo, name, short description, and price, and includes a clear "Buy" call-to-action on each product.

Implement a per-product Buy page/screen that shows product details (photo, name, full description, unit price) and allows the user to select a quantity and see a computed total price, with contact-based purchase CTAs (tel: and mailto:) prefilled with the selected product and quantity.

Update the top-level view switching so the app can navigate between Marketing, Shop (customer-facing), and Manage Products (admin) while keeping the current header behavior and marketing section scroll-to-anchor navigation intact.

Add any missing React Query hooks needed for the buy flow (e.g., fetching a single product by id using the existing backend getProduct query) and ensure loading/error states are handled with user-facing English text.

Update the frontend product management experience so that only the admin can access and use "Manage Products": require Internet Identity login and show a clear English message when the user is not the admin; hide or disable product create/edit/delete UI for non-admin users.

Add a product category field so every product can be classified as either "Hardware Items" or "Agriculture Machines", and expose this field in both backend types (Product, ProductInput) and all related CRUD methods.

Update the Manage Products (admin) UI to let the admin select a category ("Hardware Items" or "Agriculture Machines") when creating or editing a product, and display the category in the product list/cards.

Update the customer Shop page to provide an easy way to browse products by category ("Hardware Items" and "Agriculture Machines"), including an "All" option, without removing the existing product list behavior.
Add an "Add to Cart" option for products in the Shop view and implement a Cart view that lets users review cart items, adjust quantities, remove items, and see a computed total.
Add a cart navigation entry point and a "Proceed to Order" action that uses the existing contact-based ordering approach (tel: and mailto:) and includes a cart summary in the email body.

Update the marketing site branding to use the uploaded logo image in the Header and Footer by replacing the current logo image source (`/assets/generated/shankar-gared-logo.dim_512x512.png`) with the uploaded logo file `Gemini_Generated_Image_8fgrd38fgrd38fgr.png` (or `Gemini_Generated_Image_8fgrd38fgrd38fgr-1.png` if the former is not suitable), while keeping existing alt text in English.

Apply the uploaded background image `Gemini_Generated_Image_i78ybxi78ybxi78y.png` (or `Gemini_Generated_Image_i78ybxi78ybxi78y-1.png` if the former is not suitable) as the Hero background image by replacing the current Hero image source (`/assets/generated/hero-hardware-agrimachinery.dim_1600x900.png`). Ensure text contrast and readability remain strong by keeping or adjusting the existing overlay/gradient as needed.
Add newly generated, unique, clear branding images (logo + hero background) as static assets under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and ensure they are included in the build output.

Update the marketing site Header and Footer to use the newly generated logo image instead of the current `/assets/generated/Gemini_Generated_Image_8fgrd38fgrd38fgr.png`, keeping the existing English alt text unchanged.

Update the marketing Hero section to use the newly generated unique background image instead of the current `/assets/generated/Gemini_Generated_Image_i78ybxi78ybxi78y.png`, preserving strong text contrast by keeping (or adjusting) the existing overlay gradient.
Add a new static product photo asset for an Open End Wrench (usable as a shared image for multiple Open End Wrench size variants) under `frontend/public/assets/generated/`.

In the admin-only Product Management page, add an admin-only action (e.g., a button) to bulk-create Hand Tools items for Open End Wrench in multiple sizes so they appear in the Shop product list after creation.
Update the admin Product Management page to allow the admin to upload and manage multiple gallery images per product in addition to the existing primary product photo upload.

Add a customer-facing Gallery view that displays product images in a browsable gallery grid and can be accessed via the site header navigation without breaking existing Marketing/Shop/Manage Products navigation behavior.
Update the customer Buy Product page to display a product image gallery (primary image plus thumbnails/selection for any additional gallery images) when gallery images exist.
Update frontend data typing and React Query data flow to handle the new product gallery field returned by the backend and used by Product Management, Gallery, Shop, and Buy pages.

Change the app’s default landing view so that when a user opens the site, the Shop (products listing) view is shown first instead of the Marketing view, while keeping navigation to Marketing, Gallery, Buy flow, and Manage Products available through the existing header controls.

Fix the production issue where the site renders a blank page after the recent deployment by identifying and resolving the runtime error(s) that prevent React from rendering (especially in the default landing view: Shop).

Add a top-level, user-visible error fallback so that if any unexpected render error occurs, the app shows a non-blank error screen with clear English text and a way to recover (e.g., reload button and a button to go back to Shop).

Harden product image URL rendering across Shop, Gallery, and Buy Product pages so that product images cannot crash the app (e.g., safely handle missing/invalid photo/gallery blobs and show a placeholder UI when an image URL cannot be produced).

Ensure view switching never results in an empty (null) app body: if the current view state is invalid (e.g., Buy view without a selected product id), render a clear English message and a button to return to Shop instead of returning null.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a website for the hardware shop "Shankar Gared Krishi Yantra Udhog".
Update Contact section placeholders with phone number 9928281833 and email sgkyu@gmail.com.
Update the website contact/address details to include Dakbel, Bagru and PIN code 303007.
Add a product management page (admin-style) to upload product photos and manage product details (name, description, price).
Add backend support to store and manage products with fields: name, description, price, and an uploaded product photo, including create, list, update, and delete operations.
Add a "Buy" page/flow for products so users can purchase items from the product section.
Restrict product creation/edit/delete so only the site owner/admin ("me") can add/manage products (add authentication/authorization for the product management UI and related backend operations).

Add backend authorization so that only a single designated admin (the site owner) can create, update, or delete products; all non-admin and anonymous callers must be rejected with clear error messages in English.

Implement an admin ownership mechanism in the backend: store an admin principal and provide a safe way to initialize it (one-time admin setup) and to read the current admin status for the logged-in user.
Add product type/category options so products can be organized/browsed as "Hardware Items" and "Agriculture Machines" (e.g., category field and UI filtering/sections).
Add an "Add to Cart" option and cart flow for products (cart view, quantity updates, and proceed-to-buy/checkout via existing contact-based purchase CTA).
Add the provided logo and background assets to the website design/layout (apply logo in header/footer and use the background on appropriate sections/pages).

Add the 4 user-uploaded image files to the frontend as static assets under `frontend/public/assets/uploaded/` (or `frontend/public/assets/generated/` if that is the existing convention for site images), preserving the original filenames:
- `Gemini_Generated_Image_8fgrd38fgrd38fgr.png`
- `Gemini_Generated_Image_i78ybxi78ybxi78y.png`
- `Gemini_Generated_Image_8fgrd38fgrd38fgr-1.png`
- `Gemini_Generated_Image_i78ybxi78ybxi78y-1.png`
Create a new unique, clear website background image and a new unique, clear logo for the website (generate new assets rather than using the current ones).
Add product items under Hand Tools: Open End Wrench (all sizes), so they appear in the shop product list (and can be managed in the admin product management UI).
Add a gallery option on the website so product images can be displayed in a gallery view (browsable gallery section/page).

Add support for a per-product image gallery (multiple images per product) in the backend by extending the Product and ProductInput types and updating createProduct, getProduct, listProducts, and updateProduct to persist and return the gallery images in addition to the existing primary product photo.

Create and wire a conditional Motoko state migration (backend/migration.mo) to safely upgrade existing stored products to the new Product schema by initializing the new gallery field to an empty list for all existing products.

Change the site’s default landing view so that when users open the site, the Products/Shop page is shown first (instead of the marketing section), while keeping navigation to other sections/pages available.
